lines.text: practice makes
a piece for you to perform, alone, in the dark
Photosensitivity warning: This piece abruptly changes from dark to light, but these changes are brief and infrequent.
We're going to go on a walk together at night, you and I,
but we won't be moving much at all.
Make sure you're somewhere dark so you can pretend.
I'll wait.
Are you somewhere dark?

result.text: It will be harder to enjoy this piece if it's bright where you are. Try closing your eyes and pressing this button a few times to make sure you can tell the difference.

lines.text: Are you alone?

result.text: That's okay. We're always a little bit alone. Try to pretend it's just the two of us.

lines.text: Are you standing or sitting still?

result.text: Stop somewhere dark before you keep going. Our walk will be more interesting if you aren't. Sitting in a car is fine.

lines.text: The rules
There are only two rules.
1. Don't move.
2. Whenever the screen turns white, close your eyes. You're only allowed to have your eyes open when the screen is dark.
The rules
Let's practice. Close your eyes as soon as you see white.
SHUT
Great. Open your eyes again.
Could you tell the difference?

result.text: Try going somewhere darker and try again. You can press this button to see if you're somewhere dark enough.

lines.text: We're sitting at an outdoor cafe, you and I.
The sun already set an hour ago. It's late.
We've paid for our food, and we're getting ready to leave.
Imagine how you stand up, without moving.
STAND
Hm. Let's try again. Think smaller.
Imagine your calves flexing as you push against the ground,
tendons stretching away from your bones
as the machine of your body rises.
Plant your hands into the table and push down as you
STAND
You could still do better.
What part of your body is leading you away from the table?
Your foot? Your knee? Your hip?
Try that first step away, again and again,
leading with a different part every time as you
STAND
